abstract: Until late Thursday, he was the lone Republican vocally pushing for witnesses to be called in the impeachment trial.
lead_paragraph: Senator Mitt Romney, Republican of Utah, is the rare Senate Republican — actually the lone Senate Republican until late Thursday —  vocally pushing for witnesses to be called in President Trump’s impeachment trial. He is also the only Senate Republican who is seen as a possible vote to convict the president, an added distinction since Mr. Trump got every House Republican to fall in line.
